cab.content: From Viceroy, Foreign and Political Department, ftth September. 1919. (Received 8th, 11 p.in.) 1308 S. Secret. Afghanistan. Your telegram of 1st September. Acting under authority from us (given under latitude allowed us in your telegram of 16th July) Grant, after dilating on outrageous abuse of Afghan Post Office, and His Majesty's Governments decision that it should not be resuscitated in its old form, eventually told Afghan delegates that it was recognised that something or other would be required for post and trade, but that final arrangements would be matter for careful consideration hereafter.
